page.title: 06The Harbour, St.Peter Port
page.content: The harbour is a source of industry providing work for dockers, customs officers , pilots etc. There are 42 dockers and 3 foremen responsible for handling the importation of general cargo such as food, clothing and newsprint. Guernsey exports fruit, mainly tomatoes, vegetables, flowers and horticultural appliances. Tourism plays an important part in the harbour. Roll on roll off ferries and vedettes bring 500 visitors and 120 cars, on average, each day in June. Summer is the peak of the tourism industry with boats communicating from the South coast of England,the North coast of France and other Channel Islands. There is a 32 ft rise and fall of the tide. The lifeboat and St.John's ambulance boat are anchored in the harbour.
